title: Romantic Valentine single-page surprise for Hridya with interactive neon hearts and evasive 'no' button

requirements.text: Update the Valentine prompt copy to address the girlfriend by name and keep the experience single-purpose: show exactly the heading text "Hridya," and the question "Will you be my Valentine? üíï" above exactly two choices labeled "yess" and "i dont like you".

quotes: The page should be simple, romantic-themed, and have only one purpose: to ask her to be my valentine, her name is hridya.
There should be two options: yess or i dont like you .

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page displays the name "Hridya," prominently.
The page displays the question text "Will you be my Valentine? üíï".
Exactly two buttons are present with labels exactly "yess" and "i dont like you" (matching casing/spaces).
No other primary flows/pages/actions are introduced beyond asking and showing the success state.

requirements.text: Implement/keep a full-viewport animated "live wallpaper" background of many small neon hollow outlined hearts that float upward continuously from bottom to top using a pink-and-white neon heart color scheme.

quotes: The background of the pages should be a live wallpaper of small neon hollow highlighted outlined hearts floating from the bottom of the page to up.
The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white neon color heart scheme

acceptanceCriteria: A full-viewport background animation is visible behind the UI content.
Hearts are hollow/outlined with neon glow styling and use pink and white tones.
Hearts continuously move upward and recycle from bottom when leaving the top of the viewport.
The background remains performant and visually stable on iPad Chrome (no obvious stutter/freezing during normal interaction).

requirements.text: Make the hearts background interactive so pointer movement and touch input visibly affects nearby hearts (e.g., repulsion/drift and/or glow intensity changes), while maintaining the upward floating motion.

quotes: and the hearts should float upwards be fully interactive using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the cursor near hearts causes a visible interaction effect (e.g., repulsion and increased glow).
On touch devices (iPad Chrome), touch/pointer interactions also trigger the same visible interaction effect.
Interactivity does not stop the hearts‚Äô upward motion; it only modulates position/glow briefly.

requirements.text: Make the "i dont like you" button evade interaction so it cannot be clicked: on hover (mouse enter) and on attempted tap/press (pointer down / touch start), it moves to a new on-screen position within the viewport and avoids overlapping the "yess" button area.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over Nope, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on yess.

acceptanceCriteria: Hovering over the "i dont like you" button causes it to move away before it can be clicked.
On touch devices, attempting to press/tap the "i dont like you" button causes it to move away.
The evasive button always stays fully within the viewport (not clipped off-screen).
The evasive button does not overlap the "yess" button region when it relocates.

requirements.text: When the user clicks "yess", transition to a success view that shows a meme image and displays the exact caption text: "Hehehe Good gurl üòöüíó".

quotes: When she clicks Yess, show her a meme image telling her ‚ÄúHehehe Good gurl üòöüíó‚Äù.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "yess" button switches to a success state (no additional confirmation needed).
The success state renders a static meme image from the frontend (no backend fetch).
The success state displays the exact text "Hehehe Good gurl üòöüíó".

requirements.text: Provide the required static meme image asset at `frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png` and ensure the success view renders it directly via a static `/assets/generated/...` path.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png` exists in the project output.
The success view loads the image via `src="/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png"` (or equivalent static path).
The meme image renders responsively within the viewport (no horizontal scrolling on iPad).

requirements.text: Update the document/page metadata for the Valentine page so it reflects Hridya (e.g., the HTML `<title>` should mention Hridya rather than any other name).
acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab title references "Hridya" and does not reference a different name.
The page remains a single React entry point (no new routing required).

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or anything in `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose instead of editing).
Keep all backend logic in a single Motoko actor (`backend/main.mo`) and do not introduce additional backend services.
Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.
nonGoals: Add Internet Identity authentication or any login flow.
Add backend persistence, databases, or server-side APIs for this page.
Add additional pages, navigation, or features beyond the Valentine prompt and success reveal.
Integrate third-party services (analytics, social sharing, messaging, etc.).

required: Meme-style romantic image with bright, high-contrast look (valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png)
